text: Psalm 139
The Knowledge of God
For the \add music\add* director. Of David. A psalm.\f + \fr Ps 139 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
O Yahweh, you have searched me, and you know \add me\add*.
You know my sitting down and my rising up.
You understand my thought from afar.
You search out\f + \fr 139:3 \ft Hebrew “winnow”; or perhaps from another root, “measure” \f* my wandering and my lying down,
and are acquainted with all my ways.
For \add there is\add* not a word \add yet\add* on my tongue,
\add but\add* behold, O Yahweh, you know it completely.
You barricade me behind and in front,
and set your hand upon me.
\add Such\add* knowledge is too wonderful for me.
It is set high; I cannot \add prevail\add* against it.
Where I can go from your Spirit,
or where can I flee from your presence?
If I ascend to heaven, there you \add are\add*,
and if I make my bed \add in\add* Sheol, look! \add There\add* you \add are\add*.
If I lift up \add the\add* wings of \add the\add* dawn,
\add and\add* I alight on \add the\add* far side of \add the\add* sea,
even there your hand would lead me,
and your right hand would hold me fast.
And if I should say, “Surely darkness will cover me,
and \add the\add* light around me \add will be as\add* night,”
even \add the\add* darkness is not too dark for you,\f + \fr 139:12 \ft Or “does not obscure from you” \f*
and \add the\add* night shines as the day—
the darkness \add and\add* the light are alike \add for you\add*.
Indeed you created my ⸤inward parts⸥;\f + \fr 139:13 \ft Literally “kidneys” \f*
you wove me in my mother’s womb.
I praise you, because I am fearfully
\add and\add* wonderfully \add made\add*.\f + \fr 139:14 \ft Or “I am made wonderful fearfully” \f*
Wonderful \add are\add* your works,
and my soul knows \add it\add* well.
My ⸤frame⸥\f + \fr 139:15 \ft Literally “bone” \f* was not hidden from you,
when I was created secretly,\f + \fr 139:15 \ft Or “in the secret \fq place \ft ” \f*
\add and\add* intricately woven
in \add the\add* depths of \add the\add* earth.
Your eyes saw my embryo,\f + \fr 139:16 \ft Hebrew “unformed substance” \f*
and in your book they all were written—
days fashioned \add for me\add* when \add there was\add* not one of them.
And to me, how precious\f + \fr 139:17 \ft Or “difficult” \f* are your thoughts, O God;
how vast is their sum.
If I should count them,
they would outnumber \add the\add* sand.
I awaken, and I \add am\add* still with you.
If only you would kill the wicked, O God—
so get away from me, \add you\add* ⸤bloodthirsty men⸥—\f + \fr 139:19 \ft Literally “men of bloods” \f*
who speak against you deceitfully.
Your enemies take \add your name\add* in vain.
Do I not hate those who hate you, O Yahweh?
And do I \add not\add* loathe those who rise up against you?
I hate them with a complete hatred;
they have become my enemies.
Search me, O God, and know my heart;
test me and know my anxious thoughts.
And see if \add there is\add* in me ⸤the worship of false gods⸥,\f + \fr 139:24 \ft Literally “a way of an idol” \f*
and lead me in \add the\add* way everlasting.
